title: Is a BSc MLT a good course? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my views B.Sc. in MLT/MLS (Medical Laboratory Technology/Sciences) is a good course as the course is diversifying with new technologies in the respective fields and with adverse career opportunities. A person can have a secure job in private as well as public healthcare industries, diagnostic centers as well as laboratories. The person who is perusing B.Sc. in MLT/MLS will be efficient in handling and operating electrical laboratory equipment. Further after completion of degree he/she play an important role in helping surgeons and physicians in diagnosing ailments of human beings. To study the medical laboratory sciences PCTE Group of institution is one of the best college in India. PCTE is having well equipped laboratories and classrooms which help students to develop skills and enhance their personalities. It provides maximum exposure to its students in terms of hospital/laboratory visits to learn latest technologies in the respective field.

The field of allied medical science is diversifying and expanding with the advent of new technologies, methodologies, and career options. For a BSc in Medical Lab Technology, the job prospects can be bright. The person can secure a job in any public or private healthcare facility, diagnostic centre, or laboratory. Further, the career prospects can range from a laboratory technician and a research associate to a medical lab technician or laboratory manager to name a few. The person completing BSc in Medical Lab Technology will be proficient in operating electrical and electronic lab equipment. Further, he or she will play a crucial role in helping a physician or surgeon to diagnose or detect any ailment making the course a much sought after one. To study BSc in MLT, one can refer to the following institutions. Aarogyam Medical College and Hospital (Roorkee, Uttarakhand) Adesh University (Bhatinda, Punjab) Brainware University (Barasat, West Bengal) Balaji BSc MLT College (Kadapa, Andhra Pradesh) Career Point University (Kota, Rajasthan) Cauvery College of Nursing and Health Science (Mysore, Karnataka)
